meanings.definition: Not having a cap or cover.
meanings.sent1: The uncapped bottle spilled its contents.
meanings.sent2: She left the uncapped marker on the table.
meanings.sent3: The uncapped umbrella was useless in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The uncapped toothpaste tube made a mess in the drawer.
meanings.sent5: The uncapped pen dried out quickly without its cap.

meanings.sent1: Her creativity was uncapped and boundless.
meanings.sent2: The possibilities were uncapped and endless.
meanings.sent3: His energy seemed uncapped, like a never-ending battery.
meanings.sent4: The uncapped potential of the project amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The uncapped enthusiasm of the crowd was contagious.

meanings.definition: Not having a cap on a bottle or container.
meanings.sent1: The uncapped soda went flat overnight.
meanings.sent2: He forgot to put the cap back on the uncapped milk.
meanings.sent3: The uncapped jar of cookies tempted the hungry dog.
meanings.sent4: The uncapped thermos leaked hot coffee everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The uncapped water bottle spilled in her bag.
